roadscape/2hhykq-steemd.author: roadscape
roadscape/2hhykq-steemd.body:
Updates to [steemd.com](https://steemd.com) this week include:

 - Content folding (truncate long posts, click-to-reveal)
 - Compatibility with steemit.com URL structure
 - Design tweaks ('tightening up' and cleanup)
 - Cleanup of the "advanced mode" post command

For an example, see the changes in effect here:  
[steemd.com/trending/crypto-news](https://steemd.com/trending/crypto-news)

I'm supposedly on vacation but couldn't resist ;)
roadscape/2hhykq-steemd.root_title: Steemd.com update #2: content folding, UI & URL schema improvements
roadscape/2hhykq-steemd.title: Steemd.com update #2: content folding, UI & URL schema improvements

roadscape/hello-world.title: Hello World!

roadscape/post-outage-7-12-16.author: roadscape
roadscape/post-outage-7-12-16.body:
We experienced a brief hiccup in post submissions but are nearly back to 100%.

![](http://i.imgsafe.org/58d0e785db.png)

A little over an hour ago, we received a report that posting was broken -- we have found a workaround and are narrowing down the cause. It's looking like it may be due to recent change to one of the plugins -- we've been moving fast on the bleeding edge to keep up with growth and features, and a bug has caught up to us.

We apologize for this service interruption! Steemit.com is almost fully recovered and this post will be updated with any further details.
roadscape/post-outage-7-12-16.title: Post Outage 7/12/16

roadscape/steem-membership-levels--commu.author: roadscape
roadscape/steem-membership-levels--commu.body:
Instead of minnows and whales, how about breaking it down into newbies, users, and mods...

<center>![](http://i.imgsafe.org/4cd947ae0a.png)</center>

Looking forward to seeing what this chart looks like after the first payouts.. we have many new contributors being promoted to superusers, heroes, and mods!

-----

# Breakdown

"Whales" and "minnows" are nebulous terms and I was craving a more defined high-level view. 
Here's the first attempt. 

This table shows accounts grouped by log10(SP) as of 18-Jun-2016:

<center>![](http://i.imgsafe.org/4c6d98bab0.png)</center>

<center>`1 SP = 1M VESTS = 162.664 STEEM = $63.114`</center>

 - ***SP*** - It's not user friendly to measure influence in inflating STEEM, nor in raw VESTS. But VESTS are the most stable unit of influence, and *M*VESTS are easy on the eyes. I propose that 1 SP = 1M VESTS.
 - ***$*** - approximate value of the SP (at the current feed) for reference.
 - ***accts*** - number of accounts in the tier
 - ***accts %*** - distribution of accounts represented in this table
 - ***stake*** - collective influence owned by this tier (excludes @steemit and pending payouts)

# Application

My thinking is that having such tiers will make it easier to communicate relative influence. Also, **those seeking to "power up" benefit from having goalposts.** Each successive level of membership/commitment would have perks such as increased maximum upload sizes, moderation/power-user tools, etc etc.

For instance, a commonly requested feature is **fine-grained voting options**. This makes sense for *mods* and *supermods* (1.4% of today's userbase) but would only clutter up the interface for *newbies* and regular *users*.

IMO, there's potential here in terms of improved usability, marketing, communication, and reporting. But first we need to find a common language/framework.

So if Steem Power represents a user's *commitment, influence, and investment* level,

## What names would you use? 
 - How would you split it?
 - What potential benefits or USP's could we offer?
roadscape/steem-membership-levels--commu.title: Steem membership levels - community framework

roadscape/steem-membership-levels--commu.author: roadscape
roadscape/steem-membership-levels--commu.body:
Update & new reports on [steemd.com](https://steemd.com) for account levels and weight distribution, with 24h and 7d activity stats...
![](https://i.imgsafe.org/b49ee727d7.png)
Thanks for your input on the [previous post](https://steemit.com/steem/@roadscape/steem-membership-levels--community-framework), many good ideas and two major takeaways: 1. This framework has good potential for marketing and UX 2. *Moderator* is a bad word especially for ex-Redditors Note that (in a sense) *everyone* on Steemit is a moderator -- to the extent of their Steem Power. SP is a measure of a user's commitment, influence, and investment level. The "membership levels" proposed here are purely for potential UI features as well as a convenient way to communicate relative stake. The blockchain itself need not be aware of these names, and future frontends could implement their own naming systems. -----

All Accounts

![](https://i.imgsafe.org/b5d5259d1a.png) `1 SP = 1M VESTS = 171.171 STEEM = $51.694`
---- Now I've added similar reports, filtered down to accounts active in two window: 24 hours vs. 7 days. These paint a different picture and provide useful feedback. Again, I'm looking forward to seeing more balance in the weights after the 4th! Two alternate versions are in the comments section below, linked to the live (hourly) reports. **Vote your preference!**
roadscape/steem-membership-levels--commu.root_title: Steem membership levels - community framework Pt. 2 [Poll]
roadscape/steem-membership-levels--commu.title: Steem membership levels - community framework Pt. 2 [Poll]

roadscape/steemd-update-3.author: roadscape
roadscape/steemd-update-3.body:
Since the last update: 

 - Canonical links: Post pages on [steemd.com](https://steemd.com) now instruct Googlebot to prefer steemit.com URLs. This means steemd.com will rank *lower* in search results and the corresponding steemit.com pages will rank *higher*. (thanks @cryptoctopus, [more info](https://support.google.com/webmasters/answer/139066?hl=en)) 
 - The same pages now have a 'View this thread on steemit.com' link to make it easier for users to jump to the same post on the steemit.com website. (thanks @clains) 
 - Since building from develop @ [4ef97bee](https://github.com/steemit/steem/commit/4ef97beee78e4a2745da2e336ca6125007c97647), there have been no recurrances of the following crashing bugs: [#10](https://github.com/steemit/steem/issues/10), [#11](https://github.com/steemit/steem/issues/11), [#26](https://github.com/steemit/steem/issues/26), [#43](https://github.com/steemit/steem/issues/43), [#48](https://github.com/steemit/steem/issues/48) (knock on wood) 
 - Today was the first crash in 10 days. Reported on GitHub: [#71](https://github.com/steemit/steem/issues/71) 
 - Downvotes show correctly, and up/down votes are ordered by date. 
 - Extra debugging data & vote table in 'advanced mode'
roadscape/steemd-update-3.title: Steemd.com update #3

roadscape/witness-roadscape.author: roadscape
roadscape/witness-roadscape.body:
Hi all! I'd appreciate your vote for witness **roadscape** -- I'm a BitShares witness, a delegate prior to that, and I built [cryptofresh.com](https://cryptofresh.com/). The BitShares blockchain has tremendous technical depth and for months I've worked with it (mostly thru API), exploring, sharing findings, and providing basic [APIs](https://cryptofresh.com/api/docs). I plan to do something similar with [steemd.com](http://steemd.com/), as Steem runs on the same underlying toolkit.  

Steem combines several personal interests. For instance, you can see where I had started creating a social network on top of BitShares: [cryptofresh.com/posts](https://cryptofresh.com/posts). It may not look like much but it's the tip of the iceberg of possibilities I had mapped out. So reading the Steem whitepaper, I saw familiar ideas.. taken to a new level, on a dedicated chain. I'm happy to see such a capable team working on these problems, and I'm very much looking forward to being involved!  

Seed node: **seed.steemd.com:34191** (**162.213.199.171:34191**)
roadscape/witness-roadscape.title: Witness roadscape
